business.headline: Sensex crashes 1,200 points, Nifty falls below 24,000; IT stocks tumbleAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex ended 1190.34 points lower at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 to settle below 24,000.

Renewable energy stocks could make your portfolio green. 5 reasons whyWith the global shift towards clean energy, renewable energy stocks have proven to be rewarding for many, delivering strong returns.

Infosys, LTIM, HCLTech, TCS: Why IT stocks are tumbling todayInfosys led the decline with a 3% drop, while Tech Mahindra and LTIMindtree were down by 2.5%. HCLTech, MPhasis, and TCS also recorded losses exceeding 2%.

How this firm is blending sustainability in India's alcohol industryThe company's innovative approach, dubbed 'Grain to Glass', is transforming how businesses can contribute to environmental and social development.

Explained: Why newly-listed NTPC Green Energy shares gained 5% todayNTPC Green Energy share price: The latest surge follows NTPC Green Energy's announcement regarding the commercial operation of the first phase of its Shajapur Solar Project in Madhya Pradesh.

Suraksha Diagnostic IPO opens tomorrow: Check price band, issue size, GMPSuraksha Diagnostic IPO: The IPO will open for bidding on Friday and is expected to list on the stock exchanges on December 6, 2024.

Ola Electric shares continue positive rally, rise above Rs 90. Time to buy?Ola Electric share price: With this, the stock has gained over 35% in the last five sessions and has surpassed the Rs 90 target set by Citi on November 26.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: 4 reasons why Sensex plunged 1,200 points todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1190.34 points at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 points to 23,914.15.
Explained: Why LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade  LIC Stock Price: LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade despite a sharp drop in the benchmark stock market indices.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.
Sensex, Nifty open flat; Adani group shares gain up to 10% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 17.08 points to 80,217.00, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 8.05 points to 24,282.95.

Enviro Infra Engineers listing: Does latest GMP signal a strong market debut? Enviro Infra Engineers listing: The initial public offering (IPO) of Enviro Infra Engineers saw strong investor interest through its 3-day bidding process as it was oversubscribed by 89.90 times.

Stocks to watch today: Adani, Waaree, PCBL, Vedanta, Godrej Properties Stocks to watch: In today's trade, shares of Adani Group, Waaree Renewable Technologies, Godrej Properties, Vedanta, and PCBL, among others, will be in focus due to various developments.

This is a hatchet job: Mahesh Jethmalani on Adani's US indictmentIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, senior advocate and former BJP Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jatmalani defended Gautam Adani and called the US indictment a 'hatchet job'.

Adani shares rally after clarification on US bribery charges. Is the worst over? Adani Power shares closed 20% higher at Rs 525.30, Adani Total Gas gained 19.76% to Rs 694.25, and Adani Enterprises rose 11.56% to Rs 2,398.35. These were the top gainers among all the listed Adani Group companies.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as Adani stocks rally up to 20% The S&P BSE Sensex added 230.02 points to close at 80,234.08, while the NSE NIfty50 gained 82.20 points to end at 24,276.70.

HDFC Life faces cyberattack: Fraudsters steal customer data, demand extortionThe breach occurred between November 19 and November 21, 2024 and the cybercriminals managed to steal personal information about HDFC Life's customers.

Ola Electric share price jumps 18%: Should you buy now or wait?The rally in Ola Electric shares followed the company's announcement of its new electric scooter lineup, which aims to make EVs more accessible across various segments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Mahayuti leaders return after 'positive' Delhi meet, Chief Minister suspense onTop Mahayuti leaders met with Amit Shah in Delhi on Thursday night to discuss appointing the next Maharashtra Chief Minister amid a deadlock on who would assume the top post. Sources said the meeting revolved around cabinet berth allocations.

4 killings on trains, then teen's rape-murder: Serial killer caught in GujaratRahul Singh Jat, a native of Haryana's Rohtak, was arrested at Vapi railway station as part of a probe that began after the body of a 19-year-old girl was found near the tracks on November 14.

Amid severe pollution, this Delhi home maintains AQI of 10-15 with 15,000 plantsUnlike typical homes, the property does not rely on paint or plaster. Traditional construction methods have been used, with bricks bound together by lime mortar instead of cement, and lime is employed in place of modern paints.

Angela, forgive me: Putin denies he tried to scare ex-German Chancellor with dogFormer German Chancellor Angela Merkel, in her memoir, revealed that she had asked an aide to request Russian President Vladimir Putin not to bring his dog, Koni, to their meetings, as she was afraid of dogs.

New Apple ad tugs on heartstrings, X users call it 'pro-family cultural revolution'Titled 'Heartstrings', the ad depicts a man who struggles with hearing loss and the impact it has on his family life. The campaign has garnered positive reactions on social media, with some interpreting it as a response to broader cultural and political shifts.

UP Waqf Board claims ownership of 115-year-old Varanasi college, stokes rowThe Waqf Board issued a notice to the college in 2018, asserting that a mosque within the Udai Pratap College and linked properties were endowed to the board by the Nawab and should therefore fall under its jurisdiction. The claim has resurfaced now.

AR Rahman-Saira Banu's reconciliation possible: Lawyer Vandana ShahAR Rahman and Saira Banu have announced their separation after 29 years of marriage, raising questions about the custody of their three children. Lawyer Vandana Shah, who is representing Banu, discussed the potential outcomes and remained hopeful for reconciliation.

Karnataka Home Minister hints at cabinet reshuffle, new state Congress chiefKarnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara confirmed talks about a possible cabinet reshuffle and change in Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC)  president. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has been serving as the KPCC president for over four years, and is currently on an extension in the post.

Essential oils are Shraddha Kapoor's beauty secret. Are you using them right?Shraddha Kapoor swears by essential oils, and these little 'magic potions' can work wonders for your skin too, when used the right way.

Naga Chaitanya dismisses rumours of selling wedding video rightsNaga Chaitanya reacted to the rumours of him selling his wedding video rights to Netflix. He said he would be marrying Sobhita Dhulipala at Annapurna Studios on December 4 in an 'intimate and private' ceremony.

Shubman Gill returns to training in big boost to India's pink ball Test hopesIndia No.3 Shubman Gill returned to training ahead of the Adelaide Pink Ball Test match. India Today has accessed exclusive images of Gill practising in Canberra against the Pink Ball on Friday, 29 November.

Sambhal violence: UP forms judicial panel ahead of Supreme Court hearing todayThe panel will be headed by Justice Devendra Kumar Arora, a retired judge of the Allahabad High Court. The other members include Amit Mohan Prasad, a retired IAS officer, and Arvind Kumar Jain, a retired IPS officer.

Viral: Samantha, Varun Dhawan dance to Nain Matakka song at Citadel success partyActors Samantha and Varun Dhawan were seen grooving to the hit song, Nain Matakka, from Baby John at the Citadel: Honey Bunny success party. A video of them dancing is going viral on social media.

As pressure mounts on Pakistan, Champions Trophy fate to be decided todayThe much-awaited ICC Board meeting will decide the fate of the 2025 Champions Trophy, amid ongoing tensions between India and Pakistan over hosting arrangements. Here's all that you need to know about the stand-off and the likely talking points during the meeting on Friday.

Chennai man sets electric scooter ablaze outside showroom over improper serviceParthasarathy said that the electric scooter had persistent issues since the purchase, forcing him to visit the service centre multiple times.

Was Ajmer Dargah a Shiva temple? What books, Hindu petitioner's evidence suggestA court in Rajasthan's Ajmer has issued notices to several authorities on a petition seeking a physical survey of Ajmer Dargah. The petitioner cited a book to say that the Ajmer Dargah was originally a Shiva temple. What does the book and other documents on the dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti suggest?

DC's priority was Shreyas, was ready to mend ways with Pant: Parth JindalRishabh Pant's record-breaking Rs 27 crore move to Lucknow Super Giants not only rewrote IPL history but also revealed behind-the-scenes drama, including Delhi Capitals' efforts to reconcile with their former captain during the auction frenzy.

Why PAN 2.0 is the booster shot Indian businesses neededExperts say PAN as a 'common business identifier' will simplify operations and compliance for companies while helping the government regulate them better

Nayanthara's lawyer reacts to Dhanush's legal notice, says 'there is no violation' Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan's legal team has responded to the notice filed by actor Dhanush. He had initiated a legal action against the couple's Netflix documentary for allegedly using unauthorised clips from his film, Naanum Rowdy Dhaan.
Man attacks nurse with machete for rejecting marriage proposal, she fights backA video of the incident showed the woman displaying remarkable courage, managing to fend off the attacker and escape.

Exclusive: Salman Khan's 'rugged' Sikandar poster to debut on his birthdaySalman Khan will unveil the first poster of Sikandar on his birthday, December 27, 2024. Directed by AR Murugadoss and co-starring Rashmika Mandanna, the film, produced by Sajid Nadiadwala, is scheduled for an Eid 2025 release.

Pawan Kalyan slams global silence on Hindu persecution: Why are activists mum?Speaking to India Today TV, Pawan Kalyan raised strong objection over the silence of the global community on the alleged Hindu persecution in Bangladesh. He also called for the setting up of a Sanatan Dharma Board.

Uddhav Sena leader blames Congress's 'overconfidence' for Maharashtra routShiv Sena (UBT) leader Ambadas Danve accused the Congress of not valuing its MVA allies and blamed it for being "overconfident" for the alliance's stunning defeat in the Maharashtra Assembly polls.

Delhi's power demand likely to break record this winter, may cross 6,300 MWAccording to forecasts from the State Load Dispatch Centre (SLDC), the capital's electricity consumption could peak at over 6300 MW this season, surpassing the previous winter's high of 5,816 MW.

Pics: Vijay Deverakonda sends customised Pushpa t-shirts for Allu ArjunVijay Deverakonda sent Allu Arjun two customised Pushpa t-shirts from his clothing line, Rwdy, ahead of the release of Pushpa 2. Allu Arjun thanked his brother Vijay for the gift.

Lawyer Vandana Shah, who is representing Banu, discussed the potential outcomes and remained hopeful for reconciliation.

Viral: Samantha, Varun Dhawan dance to Nain Matakka song at Citadel success partyActors Samantha and Varun Dhawan were seen grooving to the hit song, Nain Matakka, from Baby John at the Citadel: Honey Bunny success party. A video of them dancing is going viral on social media.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill returns to training in big boost to India's pink ball Test hopesIndia No.3 Shubman Gill returned to training ahead of the Adelaide Pink Ball Test match. India Today has accessed exclusive images of Gill practising in Canberra against the Pink Ball on Friday, 29 November.

Watch: Shubman Gill, Rohit Sharma practice ahead of Adelaide Pink Ball TestIndia captain Rohit Sharma and batter Shubman Gill were spotted practising ahead of the Pink Ball Test match in Adelaide. Both players are expected to return to the playing XI in the next game.

Joe Root out for duck in 150th Test, goes past Virat Kohli on unwanted WTC listEngland's star batter Joe Root was dismissed for a four-ball duck by New Zealand debutant Nathan Smith in his 150th Test match. Root became the third batter to record a duck in his 150th Test appearance, after Steve Waugh and Ricky Ponting.

As pressure mounts on Pakistan, Champions Trophy fate to be decided todayThe much-awaited ICC Board meeting will decide the fate of the 2025 Champions Trophy, amid ongoing tensions between India and Pakistan over hosting arrangements. Here's all that you need to know about the stand-off and the likely talking points during the meeting on Friday.

Will Virat Kohli lead RCB? AB de Villiers drops captaincy hint for IPL 2025AB de Villiers has hinted that Virat Kohli might return as RCB captain for IPL 2025, amid ongoing speculation about the team's leadership. With Kohli's past success and a well-rounded squad, fans are hopeful for a maiden IPL trophy despite concerns over the lack of a match-winning spinner.

IPL: Too many Australians in Punjab Kings? Ricky Ponting reacts to criticismPunjab Kings head coach Ricky Ponting has reacted to the criticism of signing too many Australians for the franchise. Speaking after the IPL auction, Ponting said that those players fit their respective roles perfectly.

What is going wrong with Kylian Mbappe's dream Real Madrid move?Kylian Mbappe's Real Madrid journey hit a rough patch with a dismal Champions League showing against Liverpool, raising concerns about his adaptability and confidence in a squad struggling to maximise his unique abilities.

KL Rahul should bat at No.3 if Rohit Sharma wants to open, says PujaraVeteran batter Cheteshwar Pujara reckons in-form KL Rahul should bat at No.3 if captain Rohit Sharma wants to open in the second Test against Australia. Rahul was impressive in India's 295-run win over Australia at Perth.

Manchester United fight back for Amorim's first win, Spurs drop points vs RomaEuropa League: Manchester United beat Bodo/Glimt 3-2 to secure their first victory under new manager Ruben Amorim as Tottenham Hotspur were held to a 2-2 draw by AS Roma on Thursday.

IND vs PM's XI : All you need to know about India's pink-ball warm up gameIndia are all set to take on Prime Minister's XI in a pink ball warm fixture ahead of the day-night Test against Australia in Adelaide. Here's all you need to know about the fixture.

When Pakistan lost the hosting rights of Champions Trophy in 2009Pakistan were set to host the ICC Champions Trophy 2008 in September after bagging the hosting rights. However, the tournament was shifted out of the country and played in South Africa after a year's delay.

DC were ready to go even bigger for KL Rahul: Co-owner Parth Jindal explainsDelhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal revealed the franchise was prepared to exceed their Rs 14 crore bid for KL Rahul in the IPL 2025 mega auction, after losing out on top target Shreyas Iyer and a failed RTM for Rishabh Pant.

World Chess Championship match, D Gukesh vs Ding Liren: When and where to watchAll eyes will be on D Gukesh as he will take on defending champion Ding Liren in Game 4 of the World Chess Championship in Singapore on Friday, November 29. Gukesh won Game 3 to level the series.

DC's priority was Shreyas, was ready to mend ways with Pant: Parth JindalRishabh Pant's record-breaking Rs 27 crore move to Lucknow Super Giants not only rewrote IPL history but also revealed behind-the-scenes drama, including Delhi Capitals' efforts to reconcile with their former captain during the auction frenzy.

Prithvi Shaw is misunderstood, but IPL auction snub was needed: Parth JindalDelhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal feels that Prithvi Shaw needed a 'jolt' in his life in the form of the IPL 2025 Auction snub. Jindal also feels that Shaw is someone who is misunderstood as well.

South Africa in cruise control of Durban Test after Sri Lanka 42 all-outMarco Jansen's career-best 7/13 dismantled Sri Lanka for a record-low 42 runs, giving South Africa a dominant position in the Durban Test. The Proteas' fiery bowling and solid batting combined to crush Sri Lanka's hopes of a comeback.

Iga Swiatek breaks silence on 1-month doping ban: Worst experience of my lifeFormer World No.1 Iga Swiatek has opened up on the one-month doping ban she has accepted on Thursday, November 28, calling it the worst experience of her life. Swiatek accepted the ban after unknowingly consuming a banned substance.

IPL mega auction review: Did RCB get it right this time?IPL mega auction review: Royal Challengers Bengaluru faced the stick for missing out on big buys, but it seems it was a conscious choice as they resisted the temptation of spending big on Day 1. Under Andy Flower and Dinesh Karthik, RCB made some smart buys throughout the two-day auction, impressing their fans. Barring the Will Jacks controversy, RCB did alright.

Prithvi Shaw is misunderstood, but IPL auction snub was needed: Parth JindalDelhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal feels that Prithvi Shaw needed a 'jolt' in his life in the form of the IPL 2025 Auction snub. Jindal also feels that Shaw is someone who is misunderstood as well.

The Proteas' fiery bowling and solid batting combined to crush Sri Lanka's hopes of a comeback.

Swiatek accepted the ban after unknowingly consuming a banned substance.

Under Andy Flower and Dinesh Karthik, RCB made some smart buys throughout the two-day auction, impressing their fans. Barring the Will Jacks controversy, RCB did alright.

Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Are Australia afraid of Jasprit Bumrah? India landed a stinging first punch in Perth, beginning the five-Test Border-Gavaskar Trophy on a high. India hammered Australia by 295 runs, handing the hosts their first-ever loss at the Optus Stadium in Perth. In the latest episode of the Sledging Room Podcast, we discuss the sweet start to the five-Test series.

India should target FIFA Top 50 Rankings: Sports Minister sets high-targetIndia aims for a FIFA top 50 ranking in 10 years with grassroots football initiatives, including new academies and a focus on nurturing young talent. Collaborative efforts between AIFF and the Sports Ministry promise long-term development for Indian football.

Kamran Ghulam 103 inspires Pakistan's come-from-behind ODI series winZimbabwe vs Pakistan, 3rd ODI: Pakistan completed a come-from-behind series win, hammering Zimbabwe by 99 runs in the series finale. Kamran Ghulam's hundred and an all-round bowling attack helped Pakistan seal the series win on Friday,

Syed Modi International: PV Sindhu survives scare, Lakshya breezes into quartersPV Sindhu battled hard to overcome fellow Indian Ira Sharma in a three-game match to reach the Syed Modi International quarterfinals. Lakshya Sen breezed into the final 8 stage with a straight games win.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
